methods.name: Query
methods.description:
Build a Query object.

Queries should be built with datastore/dataset#createQuery and run via datastore/dataset#runQuery.

More information on queries.

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Datastore allows querying on properties. Supported comparison operators are =, <, >, <=, and >=. "Not equal" and IN operators are currently not supported.

To filter by ancestors, see datastore/query#hasAncestor.

More information on filtering by properties.

methods.name: hasAncestor
methods.description:
Filter a query by ancestors.

More information on filtering by ancestors.

methods.name: order
methods.description:
Sort the results by a property name in ascending or descending order. By default, an ascending sort order will be used.

More information on sort orders.

params.name: property
params.description: • Optional operator (+, -) and property to order by.

methods.name: groupBy
methods.description: Group query results by a list of properties.

methods.name: select
methods.description:
Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.

Queries that select a subset of properties are called Projection Queries.

More information on projection queries.

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: • Properties to return from the matched entities.

methods.name: start
methods.description:
Set a starting cursor to a query.

More information on query cursors.

methods.name: end
methods.description:
Set an ending cursor to a query.

More information on query cursors.

methods.name: limit
methods.description:
Set a limit on a query.

More information on query limits.

examples.code:
// Limit the results to 10 entities.
var limitQuery = companyQuery.limit(10);

params.name: n
params.description: • The number of results to limit the query to.

methods.name: offset
methods.description:
Set an offset on a query.

More information on query offsets.

examples.code:
// Start from the 101st result.
var offsetQuery = companyQuery.offset(100);

params.name: n
params.description: • The offset to start from after the start cursor.
